commit_message:
Adding iptable rules for swift-storage DIB element

Adding iptable rules to enable swift object, container,
and account servers. (Traditionally ports 6000:6002.)

Also open port 873 for rsync to enable cluster per
https://www.swiftstack.com/docs/security/node.html

Closes-bug: #1351455
Change-Id: I5de1bcf5641c17f7b1f43b7ce080797201231c6a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/09/111409/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash set eu #swift add-rule INPUT -p tcp -m multiport --dports 6000,6001,6002,873 -j ACCEPT

commit_message:
Test delete of SLAAC subnet without port delete

After you create SLAAC subnet and ports in it, you
should be able to delete subnet without port deletion.
But you can not still delete the network these ports in.
Also group all atrtributes test into one class.

Closes-Bug: 1393435
Change-Id: Ia0eaba87cd67bb20b02594a2f0db4d7bcd58a53e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/09/136909/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class NetworksIpV6TestAttrs(NetworksIpV6TestJSON): @classmethod def resource_setup(cls): if not CONF.network_feature_enabled.ipv6_subnet_attributes: raise cls.skipException("IPv6 extended attributes for " "subnets not available") super(NetworksIpV6TestAttrs, cls).resource_setup() @test.attr(type='smoke') def test_delete_subnet_with_slaac_ports(self): """ Create subnet with SLAAC DHCP, create ports in network and then you shall be able to delete subnet without port deletion. But you still can not delete the network. """ slaac_network = self.create_network() subnet_slaac = self.create_subnet(slaac_network, **{'ipv6_ra_mode': "slaac", 'ipv6_address_mode': "slaac"}) port = self.create_port(slaac_network) self.assertIsNotNone(port['fixed_ips'][0]['ip_address']) self.client.delete_subnet(subnet_slaac['id']) self.subnets.pop() subnets = self.client.list_subnets() self.assertNotIn(subnet_slaac['id'], subnets, "Subnet wasn't deleted") self.assertRaisesRegexp( exceptions.Conflict, "There are one or more ports still in use on the network", self.client.delete_network, slaac_network['id'])

commit_message:
Fix catalog view in case no application uploaded

Without this fix page background color is blue.
Now blue background is only applies to alert message.

Change-Id: If7853db5056d2baff3f3ab8bcb592196470da858
Closes-Bug: #1401550

added_lines: from mock import patch def test_start_with_tlds(self): # Stop Service self.central_service.stop() list = objects.TldList() list.append(objects.Tld(name='com.')) with patch.object(self.central_service.storage, 'find_tlds', return_value=list): self.central_service.start() with testtools.ExpectedException(exceptions.InvalidDomainName): self.central_service._is_valid_domain_name(context, 'tld.') def test_is_valid_domain_name_with_tlds(self): # Stop Service self.central_service.stop() list = objects.TldList() list.append(objects.Tld(name='com')) list.append(objects.Tld(name='biz')) list.append(objects.Tld(name='z')) with patch.object(self.central_service.storage, 'find_tlds', return_value=list): self.central_service.start() context = self.get_context() with patch.object(self.central_service.storage, 'find_tld', return_value=objects.Tld(name='z')): with testtools.ExpectedException(exceptions.InvalidDomainName): self.central_service._is_valid_domain_name(context, 'bi.z.') with testtools.ExpectedException(ValueError): self.central_service._is_valid_recordset_name( context, domain, 'invalidtld.example.org') def test_update_domain_without_id(self): # Create a domain domain = self.create_domain(email='info@example.org') # Reset the list of notifications self.reset_notifications() # Update the object domain.email = 'info@example.net' domain.id = None # Perform the update with testtools.ExpectedException(Exception): self.central_service.update_domain(self.admin_context, domain) def test_update_recordset_immutable_tenant_id(self): domain = self.create_domain() # Create a recordset recordset = self.create_recordset(domain) # Update the recordset recordset.ttl = 1800 recordset.tenant_id = 'other-tenant' # Ensure we get a BadRequest if we change the domain_id with testtools.ExpectedException(exceptions.BadRequest): self.central_service.update_recordset( self.admin_context, recordset) def test_update_recordset_immutable_type(self): domain = self.create_domain() # Create a recordset recordset = self.create_recordset(domain) cname_recordset = self.create_recordset(domain, type='CNAME') # Update the recordset recordset.ttl = 1800 recordset.type = cname_recordset.type # Ensure we get a BadRequest if we change the domain_id with testtools.ExpectedException(exceptions.BadRequest): self.central_service.update_recordset( self.admin_context, recordset)

commit_message:
Add test caller to MismatchError in test_verify_multiple_nics_order

This test is run by two different classes and when it fails the
MismatchError isn't great for fingerprinting the failure in logstash to
distinguish between test callers, so add the test caller to the error
message if this fails (which it does intermittently in the gate).

Related-Bug: #1411312

Change-Id: Ib8b4937e9c20ac05b930416ed298dc141038df5d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/93/147593/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from tempest.common.utils import misc as misc_utils msg = 'MismatchError: %s != %s' % (expected_addr, addr) caller = misc_utils.find_test_caller() if caller: msg = '(%s) %s' % (caller, msg) self.assertEqual(expected_addr, addr, msg)

commit_message:
Add cli actions to sync deployment configuration

Deployment configuration will be stored in fuel library modules,
and should be uploaded to nailgun for each release, before
we will start deployment of any environment

Version of configuration files will be determined from path,
for example at the master bootstrap stage we will need to execute

fuel rel --sync-deployment-tasks --dir /etc/puppet/

Original deployment configuration will be stored in:
 /etc/puppet/2014.2-6.0/

implements blueprint granular-deployment-based-on-tasks

Change-Id: I7c441cc49afa9f0495da8c10647e4ffec1d8573a

added_lines: # Copyright 2014 Mirantis, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import os def iterfiles(dir_path, file_patterns): """Returns generator where each item is a path to file, that satisfies file_patterns condtion :param dir_path: path to directory, e.g /etc/puppet/ :param file_patterns: iterable with file name, e.g (tasks.yaml,) """ for root, dirs, file_names in os.walk(dir_path): for file_name in file_names: if file_name in file_patterns: yield os.path.join(root, file_name)

commit_message:
Add commands to upload/download release deployment tasks

Input for deployment graph serialization will be stored in
nailgun database.

For the purpose of debuging, development and visibility of
deployment process it should be possible to modify/read this content

implements blueprint granular-deployment-based-on-tasks

Change-Id: I77e2e7a979b53e19afbfa2ea8cbf12bf49ff25c0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-fuelclient refs/changes/20/146920/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_deployment_tasks_arg(help_msg): return get_boolean_arg( "deployment-tasks", flags=("--deployment-tasks",), help=help_msg)

commit_message:
Add local clock source to ntp.conf

With new puppet NTP module we don't use local clock source for nodes,
if they are virtual. It's cause long ntp convergence time on master
node after fresh install and lead to impossibility to NTP sync on
bootstrap nodes. To fix that, we just remove check that node is virtual
(as it had done in old NTP puppet module).

Change-Id: I015cffe0e5df030e5d6142295ee27fc693b09cfa
Closes-Bug: 1298360
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/98/142798/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add local clock source to ntp.conf

With new puppet NTP module we don't use local clock source for nodes,
if they are virtual. It's cause long ntp convergence time on master
node after fresh install and lead to impossibility to NTP sync on
bootstrap nodes. To fix that, we just remove check that node is virtual
(as it had done in old NTP puppet module).

Change-Id: I015cffe0e5df030e5d6142295ee27fc693b09cfa
Closes-Bug: 1298360

commit_message:
Pool Manager Throws An Error When No Servers are Defined

Before when no servers were defined, Pool Manager ran and threw a
ZeroDivisionError.  Now, Pool Manager throws a NoServersConfigured error
and stops running.

Change-Id: Iaa5790092a7f14f6957f92c303256d94fb646fd5
Closes-Bug: 1403591
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/18/145418/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if not self.server_backends: raise exceptions.NoServersConfigured()

commit_message:
Specify static defaults rather than variable

* Specify static file name for ulimits rather than using OCF_OCF_RESKEY_binary
  as it may be specified with full path
* Move OCF resource from openstack to claster resource for consistancy
  as it contains most of our OCF scripts


Change-Id: Ibe740d8aa1d0613997868194fe7154bda145f55b
Closes-Bug: 1405657
Signed-off-by: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovatiuk@mirantis.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/99/147099/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [ -f /etc/default/rabbitmq-server ] && . /etc/default/rabbitmq-server else master_score 1000 stop_rmq_server_app

subject: Implement clone_image caching on SolidFire
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-18 17:58:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/6849270ed05b5516e949a2e2327260ad84da9ee0', 'message': 'Implement clone_image caching on SolidFire

When performing boot from Volume on none FS based devices or devices
that aren't also acting as Glance Image stores, the current process goes likethis:
1. Fetch the image from Glance Store to a temp file on the Cinder Node
2. Perform a qemu-img convert on that file (convert to raw)
3. Transfer the contents of that file to the newly created Volume using dd

This process can take a while and is pretty inefficient. This BP introduces
the option for Operators to enable image-caching on the SolidFire backend device.

When enabled this option will use the existing Cinder clone_image method,
and will create a "Template Volume" of minimum required size on the SolidFire
backend. This Volume will be created with a backend SolidFire account that can
be shared among OpenStack Tenants.

When a request is received we first do a number of checks before proceeding:
1. Is Image/Template caching enabled
2. Inspect the image-metadata and verify that the image is public,
   or that the tenant making the request is the owner
3. Verify that the image-metadata includes the properties['virtual_size']
   parameter

If the preconditions are met, create a minimal sized Volume with the requested
image; then use SolidFire's clone operation to create the requested bootable
Volume. During the process we also check and make sure that the image hasn't
been updated since we created our cached copy, if it has we then delete the
copy we have on the system and create a new one.

Change-Id: I2fac9410f504dff1aaa9fe0b9a274db7b074fa50
Implements: blueprint implement-solidfire-cloneimage
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-12-18 18:00:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/7a9e1cb148cb51f5fe555b790e21ac9c0b691ab2', 'message': 'Implement clone_image caching on SolidFire

like this:
1. Fetch the image from Glance Store to a temp file on the Cinder Node
2. Perform a qemu-img convert on that file (convert to raw)
3. Transfer the contents of that file to the newly created Volume using dd

This process can take a while and is pretty inefficient. This BP introduces
the option for Operators to enable image-caching on the SolidFire backend device.

When enabled this option will use the existing Cinder clone_image method,
and will create a "Template Volume" of minimum required size on the SolidFire
backend. This Volume will be created with a backend SolidFire account that can
be shared among OpenStack Tenants.

When a request is received we first do a number of checks before proceeding:
1. Is Image/Template caching enabled
2. Inspect the image-metadata and verify that the image is public,
   or that the tenant making the request is the owner
3. Verify that the image-metadata includes the properties['virtual_size']
   parameter

If the preconditions are met, create a minimal sized Volume with the requested
image; then use SolidFires clone operation to create the requested bootable
Volume. During the process we also check and make sure that the image hasn't
been updated since we created our cached copy, if it has we then delete the
copy we have on the system and create a new one.

Change-Id: I2fac9410f504dff1aaa9fe0b9a274db7b074fa50
Implements: blueprint implement-solidfire-cloneimage

commit_message:
Implement clone_image caching on SolidFire

When performing boot from Volume on none FS based devices or devices
that aren't also acting as Glance Image stores, the current process goes
like this:
1. Fetch the image from Glance Store to a temp file on the Cinder Node
2. Perform a qemu-img convert on that file (convert to raw)
3. Transfer the contents of that file to the newly created Volume using dd

This process can take a while and is pretty inefficient. This BP introduces
the option for Operators to enable image-caching on the SolidFire backend device.

When enabled this option will use the existing Cinder clone_image method,
and will create a "Template Volume" of minimum required size on the SolidFire
backend. This Volume will be created with a backend SolidFire account that can
be shared among OpenStack Tenants.

When a request is received we first do a number of checks before proceeding:
1. Is Image/Template caching enabled
2. Inspect the image-metadata and verify that the image is public,
   or that the tenant making the request is the owner
3. Verify that the image-metadata includes the properties['virtual_size']
   parameter

If the preconditions are met, create a minimal sized Volume with the requested
image; then use SolidFires clone operation to create the requested bootable
Volume. During the process we also check and make sure that the image hasn't
been updated since we created our cached copy, if it has we then delete the
copy we have on the system and create a new one.

Also updated those drivers with docstrings duplicating the params info.  I did
not rewrite or modify those that didn't include changed info.  I'm not sure we
should duplicate docstring info for base methods like this anyway, but that's
irrelevant for this work.

Change-Id: I2fac9410f504dff1aaa9fe0b9a274db7b074fa50
Implements: blueprint implement-solidfire-cloneimage
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/59/142859/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def clone_image(self, context, volume, image_location, image_id, image_meta, image_service):
deleted_lines: def clone_image(self, volume, image_location, image_id, image_meta):

commit_message:
xenapi: don't send terminating chunk on errors

If we send the terminator on an error, it looks like we have actually
completed the upload, when that was not actually the case, we have
failed, and ideally we want glance to notice and mark the snapshot as
failed.

This partly reverts the following commit:
e039b036b5e9dbaff8b37f7ab22c209b71bdc182

It is not a full revert of the above commit, and some of the refactoring
and error handling changes are still useful.

Closes-Bug: #1398826
Change-Id: Ib608a32556135a5b7e666d02c4ee77722ea6e07c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/24/138724/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: utils.create_tarball( None, staging_path, callback=send_chunked_transfer_encoded, compression_level=compression_level) send_chunked_transfer_encoded('') # Chunked-Transfer terminator
deleted_lines: try: utils.create_tarball( None, staging_path, callback=send_chunked_transfer_encoded, compression_level=compression_level) finally: send_chunked_transfer_encoded('') # Chunked-Transfer terminator

subject: Icehouse release for Training Guides
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-12 13:43:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/docs-specs/commit/83204a7e7d6b3dc535eadfd7a893c8784182936e', 'message': 'Icehouse release for Training Gudies

As discussed in the openstack summit, to move closer to our goals for
delivering openstack training, we concluded to move away from XML book
format and adopt RST slides for the same.

The goal of this spec is to provide description and required steps to
carry out the actions. This spec explains why Icehouse release is
important for training guides.

Change-Id: Icdbcf5f42da6c0aff3548f6d13109ebb3bbda7b7

commit_message:
Icehouse release for Training Guides

As discussed in the openstack summit, to move closer to our goals for
delivering openstack training, we concluded to move away from XML book
format and adopt RST slides for the same.

The goal of this spec is to provide description and required steps to
carry out the actions. This spec explains why Icehouse release is
important for training guides.

Change-Id: Icdbcf5f42da6c0aff3548f6d13109ebb3bbda7b7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/docs-specs refs/changes/69/141369/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ==================================== Icehouse release for training guides ==================================== Include the URL of your launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/openstack-training-guides/+spec/icehouse-release Training guides is ready to release Icehouse content. As per our discussions during the Kilo design sessions in Paris, the team came to a common conclusion to transition from XML books to RST presentations for delivering training content more efficiently and to eliminate duplication of the content. Advantages: - Easy to transition from XML to RST. - XML content will still be accessible for the current training sessions. - Repetation of content from the manuals repository will be eliminated. - Easier to get in track with the current release cycle of OpenStack. Note: Etherpad discussions for Kilo summit: https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/training-guides-kilo-summit Problem description =================== A detailed description of the problem: * XML content is to be deleted. * Migrate from XML book format to RST presentation format. * Keep the existing content for supporting on-going training sessions. Proposed change =============== * Freeze the master branch and branch it for Icehouse. * The XML content will reside in the Icehouse branch for training guides. * There will be no XML content in the master branch after the release. * Master branch will only contain RST files. Alternatives ------------ * Keep XML and RST files side by side. This alternative is not advisable as it has multiple issues with XML cross-referencing and should be avioded at all costs. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- dguitarbite Work Items ---------- * Freeze master branch for training guides repository. * Branch the master branch and name it as Icehouse. * Delete the XML content in the current master branch. Dependencies ============ None. Testing ======= References ========== https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/training-guides-kilo-summit

commit_message:
Fix bug in sheepdog driver: the wrong volume size

We give a volume size when create a volume from an snapshot,
but the sheepdog driver ignores the size.

Change-Id: I4310e7ef07e98c002ad3494e623ea243e3aad468
Closes-Bug: #1399598

commit_message:
Add pep8 jobs for python-fuelclient

After python-fuelclient has been moved into a separate repo
it is necessary to run pep8 checks on it. This patch enables
those jobs in both check and gate pipelines.

Blueprint: re-thinking-fuel-client
Closes-bug: #1411572
Change-Id: I37fc300318a4f5aaf166edc0d2727926e7aeb432

commit_message:
Added support to password auth with key pair

This commit adds support to login to system
with password authentication when key pair
is also specified, for some images without
cloud-init properly configured.

Change-Id: Ib9288f22a0e785062bc4870d5b972fde65880418

commit_message:
Nailgun documentation corrected

Section 8.1.1 "Setting up Environment" was corrected
so that to ensure that Nailgun tests pass and
Nailgun starts in fake mode.

The change set include detailed descriprion on how to
downgrade to Python 2.6, how to install missing packages,
and minor corrections such as cd, workon, apt-get update.

Change-Id: Ifea7436e516d5efdd2ff2ede5a50c1c0fb4db8a2
Closes-Bug: #1393582
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/30/136130/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. warning:: Nailgun requires Python 2.6 with development files. Please check does not match, please install Python 2.6 as described in step 1. If Python version matches, skip step 1. Please note that these instructions were tested on Ubuntu 12.04.4 (64 bit) that contains Python 2.7 and requires downgrade to Python 2.6. PPA instructions listed below install Python 2.6 but do not remove Python 2.7. The default Python version remains 2.7. You will have to specify Python version when you create virtual environment (see 8.1.1.1. step 5). #. Install Python 2.6 using `PPA <https://launchpad.net/~fkrull/+archive/ubuntu/deadsnakes>`:: sudo apt-get update sudo chmod -R a+rwx /root # Commands below will require write acccess to /root folder#. Install virtualenv. This step increases flexibility when dealing with environment settings and package installation. This step is obligatory if you need to downgrade to Python version 2.6 (that Nailgun depends on):: whereis python2.6 # Prints the intall path of python 2.6, let's say /usr/bin/python2.6. # Copy the output and paste it in the command below for option -p mkvirtualenv fuel -p /usr/bin/python2.6 # you can use any name instead of 'fuel' python --version # verify that default Python version inside virtual environment is 2.6 You can install pip and use it to require all the other packages at once:: cd fuel-web sudo chmod -R a+w /var/log/nailgun workon fuel #activate virtual environment created in the previous section sudo apt-get install puppet-common #install missing package required by tasklib tests sudo apt-get install libfontconfig #install missing package required by webui tests#. Switch to virtual environment:: workon fuel
deleted_lines: .. warning:: Nailgun requires Python 2.6. with development files. Please check does not match, you can use `PPA <https://launchpad.net/~fkrull/+archive/ubuntu/deadsnakes>`_ (Ubuntu) or `pyenv <https://github.com/yyuu/pyenv>`_ (Universal) For PPA::#. Install virtualenv. This is an optional step that increases flexibility when dealing with environment settings and package installation:: mkvirtualenv fuel # you can use any name instead of 'fuel' You can install pip and use it to require all the other packages at once.::

This drops mox in favor of mox3 which brings Python 3 compatibility and
follows what oslotest is using. It also make usage of oslotest fixture.

commit_message:
Use 127.0.0.1 instead of localhost in ceilometer.conf

Eventlet breaks with default /etc/hosts in Fedora based hosts when opening
IPv4 sockets to localhost.

Allow ceilometer to connect to mongodb using 127.0.0.1 explicitly on enabled
Fedora based hosts.

Work around for bug #1404886 bug #1325399

Change-Id: I1e6fe546499272af7ba8639c1d6b1e84f2e2d474
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/77/147477/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if is_fedora && [ -f /proc/net/if_inet6 ]; then # Ensure mongo is listening to ::1 if IPv6 is enabled sudo sed -i '/--ipv6/!s/OPTIONS=\"/OPTIONS=\"--ipv6 /' /etc/sysconfig/mongod sudo sed -i 's/bind_ip = 127.0.0.1$/bind_ip = 127.0.0.1,::1/' /etc/mongodb.conf fi

commit_message:
Rabbit: don't always start the heartbeart thread

If the selected transport doesn't support heartbeat we don't need to
start the heartbeat thread.

commit_message:
Make service-delete work in API cells

nova service-delete is handled by HostAPI.service_delete method.
Normally, it searches for relevant Service object in DB and calls
destroy() on it. However, in API cell it is over-ridden so that
service_delete message can be routed to appropriate cell. Once the
destination cell is reached, the message processor invokes
HostAPI.service_delete to perform the actual delete. This works in
case of child cells.
However in case of API cells, since HostAPI.service_delete has been
over-ridden, when the message processor invokes HostAPI.service_delete
to perform actual delete of the service, the API cell tries to again
route the message and fails in doing so with an AttributeError (as
the message is already at the destination cell and can not be further
routed).
This patch moves the object destroy() call to a separate function and
modifies the message processor to call the new function. The original
service_delete is modified to also call the new function.

Change-Id: I9148d8ceb5cdeb858dc9741b24cf0e03487c9a62
Closes-Bug: 1361186
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/51/126851/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def actual_service_delete(self, context, service_id): """Performs the actual Service deletion operation.""" objects.Service.get_by_id(context, service_id).destroy() self.actual_service_delete(context, service_id)

commit_message:
Fixes test_two_pools_three_listener

The Notification Listener Tracker class is not threadsafe,
so when a test stop an already stopped listener this one
can be restarted, due to concurrency access of the threads list and
concurrency execution of the start/stop/wait method of the notification
listener.
This result of a lockup of the test or a listener can continue to
got unepxected message.

This change fixes that by never stop the tread with the tracker callback
but only manually with the test.

This test also rename some 'Listener' to 'Server', to not mismatch
the driver listener from the notification listener.

Closes-bug: #1410902

Change-Id: I4777c7dd0ba71c61850d36641e85f33f9461e9c1

subject: Ensure we don't have stale power state in database after power action
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-15 12:56:19.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/conductor/utils.py', 'ironic/tests/conductor/test_conductor_utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/d6787b2073eea16e29444581fa7b7791789be787', 'message': "Ensure we don't have stale power state in database after power action

If the machine is shut down not via Ironic API (e.g. during maintenance)
and then power off request is made, this request will succeed, but
due to stale information in database the machine will be powered on
as soon as power sync loop reaches it.

Change-Id: Ia3ccaf1b3ab6399515c6eb6a98a0a85e3c2e6ddf
Closes-Bug: #1403106
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure we don't have stale power state in database after power action

If the machine is shut down not via Ironic API (e.g. during maintenance)
and then power off request is made, this request will succeed, but
due to stale information in database the machine will be powered on
as soon as power sync loop reaches it.

Change-Id: Ia3ccaf1b3ab6399515c6eb6a98a0a85e3c2e6ddf
Closes-Bug: #1403106

added_lines: def test_node_power_action_in_same_state_db_not_in_sync(self): """Test setting node state to its present state if DB is out of sync. Under rare conditions (see bug #1403106) database might contain stale information, make sure we fix it. """ node = obj_utils.create_test_node(self.context, uuid=cmn_utils.generate_uuid(), driver='fake', last_error='anything but None', power_state=states.POWER_ON) task = task_manager.TaskManager(self.context, node.uuid) with mock.patch.object(self.driver.power, 'get_power_state') as get_power_mock: get_power_mock.return_value = states.POWER_OFF with mock.patch.object(self.driver.power, 'set_power_state') as set_power_mock: conductor_utils.node_power_action(task, states.POWER_OFF) node.refresh() get_power_mock.assert_called_once_with(mock.ANY) self.assertFalse(set_power_mock.called, "set_power_state unexpectedly called") self.assertEqual(states.POWER_OFF, node['power_state']) self.assertIsNone(node['target_power_state']) self.assertIsNone(node['last_error'])

commit_message:
Add gabbi requirement for API testing in Ceilometer

Ceilometer is using gabbi to drive functional testing of its API.

The minimum version requirement is for required fixture support and
pattern matching response headers.

Change-Id: I0f828c1ec184bb9a6760bb18eaafb9c91550d4db

commit_message:
Gnocchi Custom Aggregation

The blueprint specs for implementation of custom aggregates
in Gnocchi.

Change-Id: Ic6ed2376e75b244cbccfa123632cdabee258ba3f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/telemetry-specs refs/changes/30/106830/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ============================= Custom Aggregation in Gnocchi ============================= We would like to be able to implement custom aggregation functions in the v3 Ceilometer API (Gnocchi) that need moving time windows, such as moving averages. This requires the retention of raw datapoints, and thus must always be calculated on-the-go. This blueprint describes a proposed extension to Gnocchi for moving aggregates. https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+spec/gnocchi-custom-aggregation Problem Description =================== When a user asks for a custom aggregate on the data, the API must check that the specified function is currently configured, then retrieve the raw data and run the aggregate function on the data. The required input parameters for the aggregate function must be specified in the query. Proposed Change =============== The proposed changes are as follows: abstract the custom aggregators into classes that can be loaded by stevedore as extensions. In the current prototype, the entry points in the setup.cfg file are in the format:: [gnocchi.aggregates] moving-average = gnocchi.aggregates.rolling_statistics:RollingMean ewma = gnocchi.aggregates.rolling_statistics:EWMA Upon API instantiation, a dict is created that maps the aggregation function name to the extension object. If the aggregation field in the request matches one of the names in this dict, the corresponding extension object is called on the data. The required parameters for these functions must be specified in the GET request:: GET /v1/entity/UUID/measures?aggregation=moving-average&window=90s& center=False The parameters are parsed by pecan and sent to the extension object as a dict. Alternatives ------------ Alternatively, the query parameters could be expressed in aggregate.param, aggregate.value pairs as done in Ceilometer's v2 api for selectable aggregates:: aggregate.param=window&aggregate.value=90s Data Model Impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- Custom aggregates functions will be called using the aggregation field and additional required parameters must be specified by keyword (see query syntax above). Security Impact --------------- None Pipeline Impact --------------- None Other End User Impact --------------------- The user must know what the required parameters are in order to successfully use the moving aggregates. Performance/Scalability Impacts ------------------------------- The raw data must be retrieved for each custom aggregate call, which could be a potential issue for large time series. In addition, the data is currently returned as a dict, which destroys time ordering, so the custom aggregate functions currently have to sort the time/value pairs in order to compute the aggregate. Other Deployer Impact --------------------- None Developer Impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: atmalagon Other contributors: eglynn Work Items ---------- Create CustomAggregator base class Implement custom aggregate classes for the prototype function: moving average Create dict of custom aggregate name, extension object pairs Add tests Future Lifecycle ================ Dependencies ============ The current tests of this proposal are being done with InfluxDB as the backend. Ultimately this change should work for all configured storage drivers. Testing ======= Tests should be added Documentation Impact ==================== Documentation should be updated for custom aggregate query syntax. References ========== * `Initial implementation`_ .. _Initial implementation: https://review.openstack.org/104415/

commit_message:
General naming and strings clean up

* Rename ironic_discoverd.{discover -> introspection}
* Prefer term 'introspection' over 'discovery'
* Rename DiscoveryFailed -> Error and make it log error message
* Change hook names to appropriate
* Various small fixes

Note that this is a breaking change!

Change-Id: I97842c7686251393dc9c7a40c92beb8a9484a0fa
Implements: blueprint v1-api-reform
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-inspector refs/changes/42/147442/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def finished(self, error=None): """Store information about a node under introspection. LOG.error('Database integrity error %s during ' 'adding attributes', exc) raise utils.Error( 'on introspection' %def active_macs(): """List all MAC's that are on introspection right now.""" raise utils.Error('Could not find node %s in cache' % uuid, code=404) :raises: Error if node is not found raise utils.Error( 'Could not find a node for attributes %s' % attributes, code=404) elif len(found) > 1: raise utils.Error( 'Multiple matching nodes found for attributes %s: %s' % (attributes, list(found)), code=404) raise utils.Error( 'Could not find node %s in introspection cache, ' 'probably it\'s not on introspection now' % uuid, code=404) raise utils.Error( 'Introspection for node %s already finished on %s' % (uuid, row['finished_at'])) * Finish introspection for timed out nodes. LOG.error('Introspection for nodes %s has timed out', uuids) (time.time(), 'Introspection timeout', threshold))
deleted_lines: def finished(self, error=None, log=True): if error and log: LOG.error(error) """Store information about a node under discovery. LOG.error('Database integrity error %s, some or all of ' '%s\'s %s seem to be on discovery already', exc, name, value) raise utils.DiscoveryFailed( 'on discovery' %def macs_on_discovery(): """List all MAC's that are on discovery right now.""" raise utils.DiscoveryFailed('Could not find node %s in cache' % uuid, code=404) :raises: DiscoveryFailed if node is not found LOG.error('Could not find a node based on attributes %s', list(attributes)) raise utils.DiscoveryFailed('Could not find a node', code=404) elif len(found) > 1: LOG.error('Multiple nodes were matched based on attributes %(keys)s: ' '%(uuids)s', {'keys': list(attributes), 'uuids': list(found)}) raise utils.DiscoveryFailed('Multiple matching nodes found', code=404) LOG.error('Inconsistent database: %s is in attributes table, ' 'but not in nodes table', uuid) raise utils.DiscoveryFailed('Could not find a node', code=404) LOG.error('Discovery for node %s finished on %s already', uuid, row['finished_at']) raise utils.DiscoveryFailed('Discovery for node %s already finished') * Finish discovery for timed out nodes. LOG.error('Discovery for nodes %s has timed out', uuids) (time.time(), 'Discovery timed out', threshold))

commit_message:
PXE: Add configdrive support

This patch adds supports for creating a configdrive partition for the PXE
drivers. When the 'configdrive' parameter is set on node.instance_info,
the code will then create a partition of the size of the uncompressed
configdrive and byte copy the configdrive onto the new partition.

Implements: blueprint expose-configdrive
Change-Id: I012e4bb8fdf4a00166f1fedae79d40449a2613ea

commit_message:
Fixes for HA fencing plugin

* Add known issues section to docs
* Add missing versioning section to docs
* Deploy the plugin only at controller nodes

Related-bug: #1411603

commit_message:
Initiate deletion of image files if the upload was interrupted

If the image is deleted by appropriate API call while its content
is still being uploaded, an exception is raised during metadata
update and it is not handled in the API code. This leads to the
fact that the uploaded image file stays in a storage and clogs it.

There existed code that safely removes image files if the exception
occurs, however it was executed only if the exception was
exception.NotFound. Now this code handles both exception.NotFound
and exception.Duplicate, which eventually triggers image content
deletion in the described case.

Change-Id: Ie6b09e4c198840e534ce21f3f317ab3f9fd04fbc
Closes-Bug: 1188532

commit_message:
Failed to discovery when iscsi multipath and CHAP both enabled

If target iscsi CHAP enabled, "iscsiadm -m discovery --type sendtargets  -p ip"
also need authentication. The authentication properties are:
    "discovery.sendtargets.auth.authmethod",
    "discovery.sendtargets.auth.username",
    "discovery.sendtargets.auth.password"

Change-Id: I1568cd08f3358ecf463dbeb8ebcc707342cdafcc
Closes-Bug: #1367189

added_lines: #!/bin/sh # Location of Linpack binary LINPACK='/opt/linpack/xlinpack_xeon64' # Location to create linpack dat file LINPACK_DAT='/root/linpack.dat' NUM_CPU=`cat /proc/cpuinfo | grep processor | wc -l` export OMP_NUM_THREADS=$NUM_CPU echo "Sample Intel(R) LINPACK data file (from lininput_xeon64)" > ${LINPACK_DAT} echo "Intel(R) LINPACK data" >> ${LINPACK_DAT} echo "1 # number of tests" >> ${LINPACK_DAT} echo "10514 # problem sizes" >> ${LINPACK_DAT} echo "20016 # leading dimensions" >> ${LINPACK_DAT} echo "2 # times to run a test " >> ${LINPACK_DAT} echo "4 # alignment values (in KBytes)" >> ${LINPACK_DAT} OUTPUT=$(${LINPACK} < ${LINPACK_DAT} | grep -A 1 Average | grep 20016) AVERAGE=$(echo $OUTPUT | awk '{print $4}') MAX=$(echo $OUTPUT | awk '{print $5}') echo "{ \"average_gflops\": $AVERAGE, \"max_gflops\": $MAX }"

fix qpid test issue with eventlet monkey patching

I516c580faef04f55fcc095d22adbfabcfa001da7 have been

the old test directory.

commit_message:
Revert "initialize objects with context in block device"

This breaks nova boot VM from functionallity

As well it breaks Rally gates so I think it is critical cause
it is blocking work on Rally.

As well this was not tested by tempest. Cause this is disabled
in gates

This reverts commit 570c98cb9e9e7327477d92c52bfdc0a28ab7f88e.

Closes-bug: #1411525
Change-Id: I5ecc165621c803726c1c8bbcd69a12d84e6a05a2

commit_message:
package swift middlware in ceilometermiddleware

Change-Id: Ibf10db8199a0ca3c639c910b3da62787e71dd179
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/telemetry-specs refs/changes/29/142129/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Example Spec - The title of your blueprint ========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+spec/ceilometermiddleware The swift middleware packaged in Ceilometer enables the generation of swift metrics which can be used to properly meter Swift activity. This cross project dependency causes issues during the upgrade chain. Problem description =================== Currently the swift middleware exists in the Ceilometer package as it leverages the functionality of the pipeline. This process is rather heavyweight as it moves a lot of the processing (building samples, republishing to correct targets) to the Swift service where as it should really exist on Ceilometer's. Additionally, having the middleware live in the Ceilometer package brings in a lot of additional dependencies unrelated to the middleware which is causing upgrade issues[1]. Proposed change =============== This spec is to proposed branching off swift middleware into its own library: ceilometermiddleware. This work is similar to the keystonemiddleware library which split the auth_token middleware into its own library to avoid additional requirements of a larger package. Additionally, the middleware will be modified to solely compute the required metric values as it does not and publish them straight to the message queue rather than loading in the Ceilometer pipeline as it currently does. Alternatives ------------ We can continue to publish via the pipeline but it is far too verbose and will not solve all dependency issues. Data model impact ----------------- We need to capture swift meters in notification agent. REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None. Pipeline impact --------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- None. Performance/Scalability Impacts ------------------------------- There will be a bit more chatter on the queues as we will be not just queuing via pipeline queue but also swift queue. Other deployer impact --------------------- None. Developer impact ---------------- New middleware should be place in new library Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: <launchpad-id or None> Other contributors: <launchpad-id or None> Ongoing maintainer: <launchpad-id or None> Work Items ---------- - create ceilometermiddleware library - move edited swift middleware to new lib - create shell in middlware that exists in ceilometer to use new lib - update devstack to use new lib Future lifecycle ================ None. Dependencies ============ None. Testing ======= - Add new tests to ceilometermiddleware - continue to leverage existing tempest tests Documentation Impact ==================== - reference new middleware References ========== [1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+bug/1403024

commit_message:
Fix static strings with labels for DVR

There are couple of static strings introduced for
DVR configuration such as the L3 agent mode.

This patch would clean up the static strings with
the labels.

Change-Id: I8e3b7b2ebb4c4de2f14a922cacf2b0f4fdcf8d46
Closes-Bug: #1411351

subject: DPDKOVS - ML2 DPDK OVS Support
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-03 14:19:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-specs/commit/2579f1da6992883f727e1d423e3f1856c78d4f03', 'message': 'This spec adds support for dpdk accelerated ovs with the qemu vhost-user
port type to the neutron ml2 plugin.

Problem Description
===================

High volume workload such as telco workloads require throughput optimised
datapaths to deliver traffic to the guest. The standard kernel vhost
implementation is not able to provide adequate performance to support telco
workloads. The qemu vhost-user interface introduced in qemu 2.1 provides an
alternative userspace interface that could be used to support telco workloads
in combination with high throughput userspace vSwitches.

Change-Id: I93e5eea96774d63c5d6f4ac11f1318e926ed5b84

implementation is not able to provide adequate performance to support telco

commit_message:
DPDKOVS - ML2 DPDK OVS Support

This spec adds support for dpdk accelerated ovs with the qemu vhost-user
port type to the neutron ml2 plugin.

Problem Description
===================

High volume workload such as telco workloads require throughput optimised
datapaths to deliver traffic to the guest. The standard kernel vhost
implementation is not able to provide adequate performance to support telco
workloads. The qemu vhost-user interface introduced in qemu 2.1 provides an
alternative userspace interface that could be used to support telco workloads
in combination with high throughput userspace vSwitches.

Blueprint: ml2-dpdk-ovs-mechanism-driver
Change-Id: I93e5eea96774d63c5d6f4ac11f1318e926ed5b84
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-specs refs/changes/42/138742/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================== DPDKOVS - ML2 DPDK OVS Support ============================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/ml2-dpdk-ovs-mechanism-driver This spec adds support for dpdk accelerated ovs with the qemu vhost-user port type to the neutron ml2 plugin. Problem Description =================== High volume workload such as telco workloads require throughput optimised datapaths to deliver traffic to the guest. The standard kernel vhost implementation is not able to provide adequate performance to support telco workloads. The qemu vhost-user interface introduced in qemu 2.1 provides an alternative userspace interface that could be used to support telco workloads in combination with high throughput userspace vSwitches. Proposed Change =============== This blueprint will introduce a new ml2 mechanism driver to support dpdk accelerated ovs with the qemu vhost-user interface. This mechanism driver will use the standard openvswitch l2 agent without modification. To an end user vhost-user is intended to be a transparent alternative to kernel vhost. This mechanism driver will interpret a vnic type of normal as a request for a vhost-user port. A new vif type (VIF_TYPE_VHOST_USER) will be defined to support the Qemu vhost-user interface. The nova libvirt vif driver will be extended to bind the new vif. The VIF_TYPE_VHOST_USER vif type will support both generic vhost-user and vhost-user for ovs based vSwitches. A new vif_binding property (vhost_user_ovs_plug) will be added to inform nova that ovs port binding in addition to the generic vhost-user port binding must be performed. The initial implementation covered by this spec will not support for security groups or tunneling. As qemu vhost-user is not compatible with iptables support for security groups will be add in subsequent versions of the mechanism driver following completion of the ovs firewall driver. For the initial implementation only vlan,flat and local network types will be supported. Support for tunneling will be added once available in upstream dpdk accelerated ovs. Data Model Impact ----------------- The database/data model will not be changed. A new value will be added vif_binding dictionary: vhost_user_ovs_plug REST API Impact --------------- None Security Impact --------------- None Notifications Impact -------------------- None Other End User Impact --------------------- none Performance Impact ------------------ OpenStack performance should not be affected by this change. This code should preform the same as the standard ovs mechanism driver. Network throughput of the guest will be determined by the dpdk vswitch used. Other Deployer Impact --------------------- To use this feature the new mech driver has to be added to the mechanism drivers list in the ml2.ini This driver will initially only support the vlan,local and flat type drivers. To use this driver a dpdk accelerated openvswitch with qemu vhost user is required. To use this feture qemu version>=2.1 is required To use this driver the node must be configured to use hugepage memory. Developer Impact ---------------- None Community Impact ---------------- This change is one of several that help support telco/nfv workloads in OpenStack with neutron by providing an alternative to sriov networking. Alternatives ------------ The standard ovs ml2 mechanism driver could be extended to detect if the vSwitch supports qemu vhost user. This would require changes to ovs to expose the support port types for a bridge. A new vnic type for qemu vhost user could be created. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: sean-k-mooney Work Items ---------- implementation of mechanism driver 3rd party ci Dependencies ============ nova vhost-user support: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/libvirt_vif_vhostuser hugepage vm memmory backing: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/virt-driver-large-pages Testing ======= None Tempest Tests ------------- None Functional Tests ---------------- Functional tests will be provided via third party ci utilising preexisting tempest tests. A subset of the openvswitch tests will be used. The subset will cover only scenarios supported by the dpdk accelerated datapath such as vlan,flat and local networks. API Tests --------- None Documentation Impact ==================== Documentation describing the supported type drivers will be added. A note saying that security groups are not supported with this driver will also be added. As the openvswitch l2 agent is used unmodified most of the configuration is already covered by the l2 agent documentation. User Documentation ------------------ None Developer Documentation ----------------------- None References ========== None

commit_message:
Fix migration 42 downgrade

Due to mixed transactional and non-transactional operations the
migration didn't work properly. The patch separates them.

Because of bug 1406314 it was not caught by tests

Change-Id: Ic6de00944fdd9d59fbb55362fa23b2610f617673
Partial-bug: 1406315

If Network contains dhcpv6-stateful Subnet less than /64, prefix-len

Closes-Bug: #1372883
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2015-01-13 14:37:46.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/linux/dhcp.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_linux_dhcp.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/f996a7b46878f543ecf775380529af10fe87b8cb', 'message': 'Specify prefix length for IPv6 subnets

If Network contains dhcpv6-stateful Subnet with prefix other than /64,
dnsmasq refuses to start if prefix-len is not specified in dhcp-range
option.  From dnsmasq(8) manpage:

    For IPv6, the parameters are slightly different: instead of netmask
    and broadcast address, there is an optional prefix length which must
    be equal to or larger then the prefix length on the local interface.
    If not given, this defaults to 64. Unlike the IPv4 case, the prefix
    length is not automatically derived from the interface
    configuration. The mimimum size of the prefix length is 64.

It is safe to always specify prefix length, so dnsmasq will use correct
configuration.

Change-Id: Ibef1f55926585016f0054accd7f7ef5a022e3fe1
Closes-Bug: #1372883
'}]
commit_message:
Specify prefix length for IPv6 subnets

If Network contains dhcpv6-stateful Subnet with prefix other than /64,
dnsmasq refuses to start if prefix-len is not specified in dhcp-range
option.  From dnsmasq(8) manpage:

    For IPv6, the parameters are slightly different: instead of netmask
    and broadcast address, there is an optional prefix length which must
    be equal to or larger then the prefix length on the local interface.
    If not given, this defaults to 64. Unlike the IPv4 case, the prefix
    length is not automatically derived from the interface
    configuration. The mimimum size of the prefix length is 64.

It is safe to always specify prefix length, so dnsmasq will use correct
configuration.

Change-Id: Ibef1f55926585016f0054accd7f7ef5a022e3fe1
Closes-Bug: #1372883

commit_message:
Add test on checking of drops when packet size is equal to MTU

- Add neutron test on checking drops statistic when packet size
is equal to MTU. Test is considered to be passed in case of more than
7 successful responces

Change-Id: I504bd60f782b8f64d99fd7b599ea64514456dad7
Closes-Bug: #1402752
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-main refs/changes/32/147132/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @test(depends_on=[deploy_ha_neutron], groups=["neutron_packets_drops_stat"]) @log_snapshot_on_error def neutron_packets_drop_stat(self): """Check packets drops statistic when size is equal to MTU Scenario: 1. Revert snapshot with neutron cluster 2. Create instance, assign floating IP to it 3. Send ICMP packets from controller to instance with 1500 bytes 4. If at least 7 responses on 10 requests are received assume test is passed Snapshot neutron_packets_drop_stat """ self.env.revert_snapshot("deploy_ha_neutron") cluster_id = self.fuel_web.get_last_created_cluster() os_conn = os_actions.OpenStackActions( self.fuel_web.get_public_vip(cluster_id)) instance = os_conn.create_server_for_migration(neutron=True) floating_ip = os_conn.assign_floating_ip(instance) logger.debug("instance floating ip is {0}".format(floating_ip.ip)) remote = self.env.get_ssh_to_remote_by_name('slave-01') cmd = "ping -q -s 1472 -c 7 -w 10 {0}".format(floating_ip.ip) res = remote.execute(cmd) assert_equal(0, res['exit_code'], 'most packages were dropped, result is {0}'.format(res))

commit_message:
Correcting Links in the Current Administrator Guide

The administrator guide includes many links to the install guides, configuration
guide, and so forth.  As the administrator guide is the current version all links
should link to current (Juno) vs. Icehouse or trunk (Kilo) versions of the docs.

Closes-Bug: #1410565

Change-Id: I8fa3bc6d0af2ee90f436fe065b8897eefefa2be9

commit_message:
Add cli actions to sync deployment configuration

Deployment configuration will be stored in fuel library modules,
and should be uploaded to nailgun for each release, before
we will start deployment of any environment

Version of configuration files will be determined from path,
for example at the master bootstrap stage we will need to execute

fuel rel --sync-deployment-tasks --dir /etc/puppet/

Original deployment configuration will be stored in:
 /etc/puppet/2014.2-6.0/

implements blueprint granular-deployment-based-on-tasks

Change-Id: I7c441cc49afa9f0495da8c10647e4ffec1d8573a

You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import os def find_files(dir_path, file_patterns): """Returns generator where each item is a path to file, that satisfies file_patterns condtion :param dir_path: path to directory, e.g /etc/puppet/ :param file_patterns: iterable with file name, e.g (tasks.yaml,) """ for root, dirs, file_names in os.walk(dir_path): for file_name in file_names: if file_name in file_patterns: yield os.path.join(root, file_name)

commit_message:
Add commands to upload/download release deployment tasks

Input for deployment graph serialization will be stored in
nailgun database.

For the purpose of debuging, development and visibility of
deployment process it should be possible to modify/read this content

implements blueprint granular-deployment-based-on-tasks

Change-Id: I77e2e7a979b53e19afbfa2ea8cbf12bf49ff25c0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/28/142428/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: deployment_tasks_path = 'releases/{0}/deployment_tasks' def get_deployment_tasks(self): url = self.deployment_tasks_path.format(self.id) return self.connection.get_request(url) def update_deployment_tasks(self, data): url = self.deployment_tasks_path.format(self.id) return self.connection.put_request(url, data)

commit_message:
Create port in allowed allocation pools

Add test to create port in allowed allocation pools
   -Create a network
   -Create a subnet by specifying allocation pools
   -Create a port
   -Verify the port ip_address is within the range of allocation pools

Change-Id: If4afe99762bb3908de91de454a34703b8c278f62
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/66/142066/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import netaddr cls._subnet_data = {6: {'allocation_pools': cls._get_allocation_pools_from_gateway(6)}, 4: {'allocation_pools': cls._get_allocation_pools_from_gateway(4)}} @classmethod def _get_allocation_pools_from_gateway(cls, ip_version): """Return allocation range for subnet of given gateway""" gateway = cls._get_gateway_from_tempest_conf(ip_version) return [{'start': str(gateway + 2), 'end': str(gateway + 4)}] @classmethod def _get_gateway_from_tempest_conf(cls, ip_version): """Return first subnet gateway for configured CIDR """ if ip_version == 4: cidr = netaddr.IPNetwork(CONF.network.tenant_network_cidr) mask_bits = CONF.network.tenant_network_mask_bits elif ip_version == 6: cidr = netaddr.IPNetwork(CONF.network.tenant_network_v6_cidr) mask_bits = CONF.network.tenant_network_v6_mask_bits if mask_bits >= cidr.prefixlen: return netaddr.IPAddress(cidr) + 1 else: for subnet in cidr.subnet(mask_bits): return netaddr.IPAddress(subnet) + 1 def subnet_dict(self, include_keys): """Return a subnet dict which has include_keys and their corresponding value from self._subnet_data """ return dict((key, self._subnet_data[self._ip_version][key]) for key in include_keys) def test_to_create_port_in_allowed_allocation_pools(self): network = self.create_network() net_id = network['id'] self.create_subnet(network, **self.subnet_dict(['allocation_pools'])) _, body = self.client.create_port(network_id=net_id) port = body['port'] self.addCleanup(self._delete_port, port['id']) ip_address = port['fixed_ips'][0]['ip_address'] allocation_pools = self.subnet_dict(['allocation_pools']) end_ip_address = allocation_pools['allocation_pools'][0]['end'] self.assertLessEqual(ip_address, end_ip_address)

commit_message:
Add migration tests for PostgreSQL

Fix migrations for PostgresSQL:
002_quota_class - PostgreSQL-specific reservations foreign key name
004_volume_type_to_uuid - while downgraging volume_type_id from string to int
PostgreSQL can't do it automatically

Change-Id: I68b8608a85594501536835ddc9dc87bcd2dd80c4
Closes-Bug: #1266595

commit_message:
Use is_valid_ipv6 from oslo.utils

Remove _is_valid_ipv6 from Cinder and replace it's usages
by usages of is_valid_ipv6 from netutils, because this methods
implements the same functionality.

Change-Id: Ica16f0a34abc2f0c6f7240fe553a494d77dedc16

commit_message:
Fix the continuation line indent to pass flake8

The flake8 complains "E128 continuation line under-indented for
visual indent" on cinder/tests/api/contrib/test_types_manage.py
line 270. The continuation line should be indented to the opening
parentheses. This patch fixes the indention.

Change-Id: I8330e2580863ed4d53b5607c25fc5317c5a166b9

of the module.

commit_message:
LIO: Fix UnboundLocalError in ensure_export

If db.volume_get() fails here, volume_info (and chap_auth)
are unbound, and the below usages will fail.

volume_get() failing is the only way to land in the NotFound
handler, so just remove this debug line.  It won't ever have
info to print.

Move code not related to db lookup out of this try block, and
return when NotFound occurs.

Closes-Bug: #1387866

Change-Id: I13a88bec1a66d8a0794b08514cc9844d60f6c809
(cherry picked from commit dac4e044660b20eb4aed80cfe58cd9d5b88e14a7)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/50/147650/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: (auth_method, auth_user, auth_pass) = volume_info['provider_auth'].split(' ', 3) chap_auth = self._iscsi_authentication(auth_method, auth_user, auth_pass) except exception.NotFound: LOG.debug("volume_info:%s", volume_info)

commit_message:
Enable adding new tag with options

It is useful to add a new tag when update the options
with dnsmasq.
We have a use case in Ironic to support ipxe with dnsmasq.
It looks like this:
dhcp_opts.append({'opt_name': 'tag:!ipxe,bootfile-name',
                  'opt_value': CONF.pxe.pxe_bootfile_name})

Change-Id: Idfaae9e8f8b7582f988e9da8707ef7d4823c6ff4
Closes-Bug: #1384577
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/98/130498/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: options = option.split(',') extra_tag = None if options[0].startswith('tag:'): extra_tag = options[0] option = options[1] if extra_tag: tags = ('tag:' + tag, extra_tag, '%s' % option) else: tags = ('tag:' + tag, '%s' % option) return ','.join(tags + args)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-13 22:31:17.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/elements/cache-devstack/extra-data.d/50-early-source-repo'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/b8932165ba2251d332c517079b3613f1d013cd23', 'message': "Fix DIB image cache path in DIB element

The DIB cache-devstack element's early-source-repos script was using a
hardcoded cache path rather than rooting at $DIB_IMAGE_CACHE. This meant
that for this portion of the DIB builds they insisted on writing to the
current users homedir and not the overridden cache path. Root the cache
path properly against $DIB_IMAGE_CACHE so that an overridden path is
properly used.

Change-Id: I9c84de7497bd9259b5660e78e84d2adc86f9d61c
"}]
commit_message:
Fix DIB image cache path in DIB element

The DIB cache-devstack element's early-source-repos script was using a
hardcoded cache path rather than rooting at $DIB_IMAGE_CACHE. This meant
that for this portion of the DIB builds they insisted on writing to the
current users homedir and not the overridden cache path. Root the cache
path properly against $DIB_IMAGE_CACHE so that an overridden path is
properly used.

Change-Id: I9c84de7497bd9259b5660e78e84d2adc86f9d61c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/98/146998/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: CACHE_BASE=$DIB_IMAGE_CACHE/source-repositories OLD_CACHE_BASE=$DIB_IMAGE_CACHE/repository-sources

commit_message:
Use constants for runner state machine event names

Instead of using strings it is better if we can use constants (that
may be the same/adjusted strings) and use those instead in the state
machine used in the runner.

The names are adjusted (and the state graph diagram and docstring)
to reflect names that fit better with there intended meaning and
usage.

Change-Id: Iaf229d6e37730545ba9f2708d118697cb7145992
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/taskflow refs/changes/98/147698/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Event name constants the state machine uses. _SCHEDULE = 'schedule_next' _WAIT = 'wait_finished' _ANALYZE = 'examine_finished' _FINISH = 'completed' _FAILED = 'failed' _SUSPENDED = 'suspended' _SUCCESS = 'success' _REVERTED = 'reverted' _START = 'start' +--------------+------------------+------------+----------+---------+ Start | Event | End | On Enter | On Exit +--------------+------------------+------------+----------+---------+ ANALYZING | completed | GAME_OVER | | ANALYZING | schedule_next | SCHEDULING | | ANALYZING | wait_finished | WAITING | | FAILURE[$] | | | | GAME_OVER | failed | FAILURE | | GAME_OVER | reverted | REVERTED | | GAME_OVER | success | SUCCESS | | GAME_OVER | suspended | SUSPENDED | | RESUMING | schedule_next | SCHEDULING | | REVERTED[$] | | | | SCHEDULING | wait_finished | WAITING | | SUCCESS[$] | | | | SUSPENDED[$] | | | | UNDEFINED[^] | start | RESUMING | | WAITING | examine_finished | ANALYZING | | +--------------+------------------+------------+----------+---------+ return _SCHEDULE return _FAILED if self._analyzer.get_next_nodes(): return _SUSPENDED elif self._analyzer.is_success(): return _SUCCESS else: return _REVERTED return _WAIT return _ANALYZE return _SCHEDULE elif memory.not_done: return _WAIT else: return _FINISH m.add_transition(_GAME_OVER, st.REVERTED, _REVERTED) m.add_transition(_GAME_OVER, st.SUCCESS, _SUCCESS) m.add_transition(_GAME_OVER, st.SUSPENDED, _SUSPENDED) m.add_transition(_GAME_OVER, st.FAILURE, _FAILED) m.add_transition(_UNDEFINED, st.RESUMING, _START) m.add_transition(st.ANALYZING, _GAME_OVER, _FINISH) m.add_transition(st.ANALYZING, st.SCHEDULING, _SCHEDULE) m.add_transition(st.ANALYZING, st.WAITING, _WAIT) m.add_transition(st.RESUMING, st.SCHEDULING, _SCHEDULE) m.add_transition(st.SCHEDULING, st.WAITING, _WAIT) m.add_transition(st.WAITING, st.ANALYZING, _ANALYZE) m.add_reaction(_GAME_OVER, _FINISH, game_over) m.add_reaction(st.ANALYZING, _ANALYZE, analyze) m.add_reaction(st.RESUMING, _START, resume) m.add_reaction(st.SCHEDULING, _SCHEDULE, schedule) m.add_reaction(st.WAITING, _WAIT, wait) for (_prior_state, new_state) in machine.run_iter(_START):

commit_message:
Compile Horizon message catalogs during stack.sh

Backporting patch from master to stable/juno branch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/128601/

Change-Id: I7f61e80bd7f26a7d99474618f773a737afcfbef3
Closes-Bug: 1409587
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/87/146387/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Compile message catalogs. # Horizon is installed as develop mode, so we can compile here. # Message catalog compilation is handled by Django admin script, # so compiling them after the installation avoids Django installation twice. (cd $HORIZON_DIR; ./run_tests.sh -N --compilemessages) # Compile message catalogs before installation _prepare_message_catalog_compilation (cd $dir; python setup.py compile_catalog)# NOTE: It can be moved to common functions, but it is only used by compilation # of django_openstack_auth catalogs at the moment. function _prepare_message_catalog_compilation { local babel_package=$(grep ^Babel $REQUIREMENTS_DIR/global-requirements.txt) pip_install "$babel_package" }

commit_message:
"neutron help net-create" help info updated

Initially, we were unable to see complete help
info for provider network attributes in
"neutron net-create" command.

Now, with this patch complete help info is
displayed to the user.

including:
      --provider:network_type
      --provider:physical_network
      --provider:segmentation_id

Change-Id: I989ac1557c5aef79e5385c7c9d2acc598c103d70
Closes-Bug: #1377357

added_lines: '--provider:network_type', dest='provider_network_type', choices=['local', 'flat', 'vlan', 'gre', 'vxlan'], help=_('Set the type of provider network (Admin only).')) parser.add_argument( '--provider:physical_network', dest='provider_physical_network', metavar='PHYS_NET_NAME', help=_('Set the name of physical network for ' 'flat or VLAN network (Admin only).')) parser.add_argument( '--provider:segmentation_id', dest='provider_segmentation_id', metavar='{VID,TUNNEL_ID,VNID}', help=_('Set the VID for VLAN network or TUNNEL_ID for ' 'GRE network or VNID for VXLAN network (Admin only).')) parser.add_argument( if parsed_args.provider_network_type: body['network'].update({'provider:network_type': parsed_args.provider_network_type}) if parsed_args.provider_physical_network: body['network'].update({'provider:physical_network': parsed_args.provider_physical_network}) if parsed_args.provider_segmentation_id: body['network'].update({'provider:segmentation_id': parsed_args.provider_segmentation_id})

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-12 03:27:18.000000000', 'files': ['cinderclient/utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-cinderclient/commit/6126cc843f4011f1b08a8acdc04f35dbb968d87e', 'message': 'Allow to find resource with digit name

When we are trying to create a volume by the name of numbers [0011] then
volume is created with that name but when we are trying to delete/show this
volume then " Not Found (HTTP 404) " error occurs. It's caused by mtehod
'find_resource' taking digit name as id. Add 'is_alphanum_id_allowed'

commit_message:
Allow to find resource with digit name

When we are trying to create a volume by the name of numbers [0011] then
volume is created with that name but when we are trying to delete/show this
volume then " Not Found (HTTP 404) " error occurs. It's caused by mtehod
'find_resource' taking digit name as id. Add 'is_alphanum_id_allowed'
attribute to manager if alphanum id is allowed for the resource.

Change-Id: Icebde4da5f9cfbefdae4fe4cbcc7726875ff0584
Closes-bug: #1398814
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-cinderclient refs/changes/58/141258/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # for str id which is not uuid if getattr(manager, 'is_alphanum_id_allowed', False): try: except exceptions.NotFound: pass
deleted_lines: # first try to get entity as integer id try: if isinstance(name_or_id, int) or name_or_id.isdigit(): except exceptions.NotFound: pass

'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-01-16 03:03:14.000000000', 'files': ['magnumclient/shell.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-magnumclient/commit/17bdfa26cac542d1055e449786ca93a622febd8f', 'message': 'Fix an error on not finding log handler

When server return a failure response, magnumclient will use the python
logging library to log the status. The library will attempt to log the
failure by finding a log handler to do the actual logging tasks. If there
is no log handler, no message will be logged and the error message below
will be printed.

No handlers could be found for logger "magnumclient.common.httpclient"

In before, magnumclient did not add any log handler on non-debug mode,
which is a bug. This commit is for fixing that. It should be mentioned
that there is another commit 5b59253667a12a1b592d967bbcaa1f1adda559d3

'}]
commit_message:
Fix an error on not finding log handler

When server return a failure response, magnumclient will use the python
logging library to log the status. The library will attempt to log the
failure by finding a log handler to do the actual logging tasks. If there
is no log handler, no message will be logged and the error message below
will be printed.

No handlers could be found for logger "magnumclient.common.httpclient"

In before, magnumclient did not add any log handler on non-debug mode,
which is a bug. This commit is for fixing that. It should be mentioned
that there is another commit 5b59253667a12a1b592d967bbcaa1f1adda559d3
(which has been reverted by 442e08b2895ad7eae29ce8ee7ffa0e4ba445f36c)
for addressing the same problem. However, this commit is a better fix since
it calls function basicConfig to add a default handler to root logger,
which ensure that there is always a handler globally.

Related-Bug: 1410444
Related-Bug: 1410507
Related-Bug: 1410510
Change-Id: I1697ff2d4fb47cdabf8da19ba862abcaed3a44ee
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-magnumclient refs/changes/96/147596/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if debug: streamformat = "%(levelname)s (%(module)s:%(lineno)d) %(message)s" # Set up the root logger to debug so that the submodules can # print debug messages logging.basicConfig(level=logging.DEBUG, format=streamformat) else: streamformat = "%(levelname)s %(message)s" logging.basicConfig(level=logging.CRITICAL, format=streamformat)
deleted_lines: if not debug: return streamformat = "%(levelname)s (%(module)s:%(lineno)d) %(message)s" # Set up the root logger to debug so that the submodules can # print debug messages logging.basicConfig(level=logging.DEBUG, format=streamformat)

commit_message:
Add Event and Trait API to document

WebAPI has nothing about Event and Trait API, this patch fix it.

Note: sphinxcontrib-pecanwsme has a bug, cannot handle the issue that
there is an unexposed path in URL. This patch exposes
EventTypesController.get_one as a workaround.

Change-Id: If881d674ee71d55edc22db85a53ba972b5858be5
Closes-Bug: #1388514

commit_message:
libvirt: set guest cpu_shares value as a multiple of guest vCPUs

Currently, a default value of cpu_shares is being assigned to all
guest instances, regardless of the number of vCPUs has been
configured for each guest. As cpu_shares are specifying the weight
to provide CPU time, this reduces the amount of time each
vCPU gets, for instances with a higher number of vCPUs.

Setting the default value of guest cpu.shares to be a multiple of
the number of guest vcpus.

Closes-Bug: #1383377

Change-Id: I3a669da3536061919e3673da88c102a868999902

commit_message:
Added ability to listen HTTPS port

* Added oslo-inclubator 'sslutils' module dependency
* Added config params from sslutils
* Added ability to make SSL port for sahara-api

Implements blueprint: sahara-support-https

Change-Id: I184e39b6a0eb6ad17b51aa408a65a455983bfb0c

commit_message:
improve the neutron configuration in install-guide

In this patch, improve the neutron configuration for the flat network:

If neutron-openvswitch-agent run with ovs_neutron_plugin.ini as the input
"--config-file", we have to edit ovs_neutron_plugin.ini, to add the [ovs]
section to enable the bridge mappings configuration.

Change-Id: Ibbd4fe384366c571d750cc1af44b2e866d6902b6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/49/143349/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #. If neutron-openvswitch-agent run with ovs_neutron_plugin.ini as the input config-file, we have to edit ovs_neutron_plugin.ini, to add the above [ovs] section to enable the bridge mappings configuration. fail_mode: secure type: patch options: {peer="phy-br-eth2"} Port "phy-br-eth2" Interface "phy-br-eth2" type: patch options: {peer="int-br-eth2"} Port "eth2" Interface "eth2" ovs_version: "2.3.0" --router:external --provider:network_type flat \ --provider:physical_network physnet1

commit_message:
Make rest_client module py34-compatible

We are testing tempest-lib on py27 and py34 now.
To move rest_client module to tempest-lib, this patch makes it
py34-compatible.

* iteritems() has been removed since py3.
* items() returns dict_keys object on py3, so it is necessary to
  convert the return value with list() clearly to avoid TypeError.

Change-Id: Ie9105b5d01e7883213c1d3398cc5fe56782920d9

deleted_lines: resp = dict((k.lower(), v) for k, v in resp.iteritems())

commit_message:
Move fake get_credentials methods to test_auth

fake_auth_provider needed fake_credentials which needs auth module which
needs keystone service clients for implementing fake get_credentials and
get_default_credentials. So this dependency blocked moving rest_client
module to tempest-lib because test_rest_client needs fake_auth_provider
like:

  rest_client
     -> test_rest_client
        -> fake_auth_provider
           -> fake_credentials
              -> auth
                 -> identity_client of v2 and v3
                    -> rest_client

So a dependency loop existed.
Both get_credentials and get_default_credentials of fake_auth_provider
were used in test_auth only.
So this patch moves fake get_credentials methods to test_auth for breaking
the dependency loop.

Change-Id: Id12341de52204e2c428e10b4b758b700b0fbab09
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/03/147403/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def fake_get_default_credentials(credential_type, fill_in=True): return fake_credentials.FakeCredentials() def fake_get_credentials(credential_type=None, fill_in=True, **kwargs): return fake_credentials.FakeCredentials() self.stubs.Set(auth, 'get_credentials', fake_get_credentials) fake_get_default_credentials)
deleted_lines: from tempest.tests import fake_auth_provider self.stubs.Set(auth, 'get_credentials', fake_auth_provider.get_credentials) fake_auth_provider.get_default_credentials)

subject: Use tgt-admin --update ALL
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-14 23:16:34.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/targets/tgt.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/107fb0100ca9cf4d0bb10469a69bdd5e609aa1b5', 'message': "Use tgt-admin --update ALL

For target creation using tgtadm driver, we create a persistence
file for the target, then send a tgt-admin --update 'name' where
name is the specific persistence file we want to read in and update
from.

It turns out that we can hit race conditions where the persistence
file is written, and an update is requested but target has already
done work to make it believe that the target has already been created.

There are two ways this might be fixed:
1. Just catch the already exists exception, wait a second and retry
2. Try and use an update ALL instead of a targeted file

The update ALL option doesn't care what currently exists or is active,
it just reads everything in the persistence file and verifies there's a
target for each entry.  It should not reset or impact in-use targets
because we're not using the --force option.

Change-Id: I1b46680d43c41ed98fdc593bc7f4c670e9f3dc29
"}]
commit_message:
Use tgt-admin --update ALL

For target creation using tgtadm driver, we create a persistence
file for the target, then send a tgt-admin --update 'name' where
name is the specific persistence file we want to read in and update
from.

It turns out that we can hit race conditions where the persistence
file is written, and an update is requested but target has already
done work to make it believe that the target has already been created.

There are two ways this might be fixed:
1. Just catch the already exists exception, wait a second and retry
2. Try and use an update ALL instead of a targeted file

The update ALL option doesn't care what currently exists or is active,
it just reads everything in the persistence file and verifies there's a
target for each entry.  It should not reset or impact in-use targets
because we're not using the --force option.

Change-Id: I1b46680d43c41ed98fdc593bc7f4c670e9f3dc29
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/28/147328/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(jdg): Let's just try a --update ALL that may # help avoid various race conditions (out, err) = utils.execute('tgt-admin', '--update', 'ALL',

commit_message:
Move sql specific filter test code into test_backend_sql

The test for ensuring we are not prone to sql injection attacks
was incorrectly in the main test_backend.py.

Change-Id: I434ed090ad8407091cca9608a5dbaeb4d5ab9053
Closes-bug: 1410750

commit_message:
Allow specification of ironic callback timeout

We need to be able to adjust Ironic's timeout for a node's deployment
callback.  The default is much longer than Tempest's server build
timeout, causing Ironic deployment issues to be masked by more generic
server timeouts in the tempest logs.  Being able to set this to be
lower than the nova timeout, we'll have Ironic errors that we can
fingerprint.

Change-Id: I7b8eeda504da7ffd64967bbcfa2625acf418f263
Related-bug: #1408067
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/26/145326/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

I went through all the patches in this series, and I think this covers
