commit_message:
Restrict changes to existing Alarm Definitions

Once an Alarm Definition has been created, match_by and any metrics
in the expression cannot be changed. This is because those fields
control the metrics used to create Alarms and Alarms may already
have been created. The function, operator, period, periods and any
boolean operators can change, but not the metrics in subexpressions
or of the number sub expressions.  All other fields in an Alarm
Definition can be changed

Add tests for new functionality and some old for patch and update

Fix a bug where match-by was being cleared in patch if not given

Update api docs for the restrictions

Fix minor typos in api docs

Change-Id: I89a46838847b9cb73a073f9dd91db8f9391b6019
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-api refs/changes/46/146946/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - [Changing Alarm Definitions](#changing-alarm-definitions)Now if another system is configured into the monitoring service, then its cpu.idle_perc metric will be added to the Alarm for Alarm Definition 1 and a new Alarm will be created for Alarm Definition 2, all without any user intervention. The system will be monitored without requiring the user to explicitly add alarms for the new system as other monitoring systems require.Period must an integer multiple of 60. The default period is 60 seconds.### Changing Alarm Definitions Once an Alarm Definition has been created, the value for match_by and any metrics in the expression cannot be changed. This is because those fields control the metrics used to create Alarms and Alarms may already have been created. The function, operator, period, periods and any boolean operators can change, but not the metrics in subexpressions or of the number sub expressions. All other fields in an Alarm Definition can be changed. The only option to change metrics or match_by is to delete the existing Alarm Definition and create a new one. Deleting an Alarm Definition will delete all Alarms associated with it. * name (string(250), required) - A descriptive name of the notification method.* match_by ([string], optional) - The metric dimensions to use to create unique alarms* match_by ([string]) - The metric dimensions to use to create unique alarms* match_by ([string]) - The metric dimensions to use to create unique alarms* match_by ([string], optional) - The metric dimensions to use to create unique alarms. If specified, this MUST be the same as the existing value for match_byOnly the parameters that are specified will be updated. See Changing Alarm Definitions for restrictions on changing expression and match_by. * match_by ([string]) - The metric dimensions to use to create unique alarms* match_by ([string], optional) - The metric dimensions to use to create unique alarms. If specified, this MUST be the same as the existing value for match_byOnly the parameters that are specified will be updated. See Changing Alarm Definitions for restrictions on changing expression and match_by.* match_by ([string]) - The metric dimensions to use to create unique alarms

The default period is 60 seconds.* name (string(250), required) - A descriptive name of the notifcation method.* match_by ([string], optional) - The metric dimensions to match to the alarm dimensions.* match_by ([string]) - The metric dimensions to match to the alarm dimensions* match_by ([string]) - The metric dimensions to match to the alarm dimensions* match_by ([string], optional) - The metric dimensions to match to the alarm dimensions* match_by ([string]) - The metric dimensions to match to the alarm dimensions* match_by ([string], optional) - The metric dimensions to match to the alarm dimensionsOnly the parameters that are specified will be updated.* match_by ([string]) - The metric dimensions to match to the alarm dimensions

commit_message:
Switch to using oslo_i18n instead of oslo.i18n

The oslo team is recommending everyone to switch to the
non-namespaced versions of libraries. Updating the hacking
rule to include a check to prevent i18n import from oslo
namespace from creeping back in.

Change-Id: If63dbe5792b7243693bd164a6a35b5a24d55c759
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/65/146365/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Switch to using oslo_db instead of oslo.db

The oslo team is recommending everyone to switch to the
non-namespaced versions of libraries. Updating the hacking
rule to include a check to prevent db import from oslo
namespace from creeping back in.

Change-Id: I17e1c13461a71b6c97d07383e37c20ce811816c0

commit_message:
Switch to using oslo_utils instead of oslo.utils

The oslo team is recommending everyone to switch to the
non-namespaced versions of libraries. Updating the hacking
rule to include a check to prevent oslo.utils import from
creeping back in.

Change-Id: Ib9d9cd0792a5f8b36e84cf601b0ed6690579685e

commit_message:
Add first unit test for 0MQ

Adding simple driver load test, many more to come.

Change-Id: If1c51eb9623c0758b74d585e6c390edbcaa9366c
Partial-bug: #1302941
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging refs/changes/05/93905/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2013 Red Hat, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import testscenarios from oslo import messaging from oslo.messaging._drivers import impl_zmq as zmq_driver from tests import utils as test_utils load_tests = testscenarios.load_tests_apply_scenarios class TestZmqDriverLoad(test_utils.BaseTestCase): def setUp(self): super(TestZmqDriverLoad, self).setUp() self.messaging_conf.transport_driver = 'zmq' self.messaging_conf.in_memory = True def test_driver_load(self): transport = messaging.get_transport(self.conf) self.assertIsInstance(transport._driver, zmq_driver.ZmqDriver)

commit_message:
Switch to using oslo_serialization instead of oslo.serialization

The oslo team is recommending everyone to switch to the
non-namespaced versions of libraries. Updating the hacking
rule to include a check to prevent serialization import from oslo
namespace from creeping back in.

Change-Id: Ic48888ddcab4414f8a1047d5edfe3ead766c932e

commit_message:
initialize objects with context in compute manager

These changes aim to clean up the pattern of passing a context in
object member functions create/destroy/refresh/save and instead
initialize the object with the context when it's constructed.

Related to blueprint kilo-objects

Change-Id: Ic0291d2b9536c9318ef4e1daec0007cb3e106aef
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/63/135763/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add share driver for Huawei V3 Storage

Add share driver for Huawei V3 Storage system using REST API.
Both the NFS and CIFS protocols are supported.
Following interfaces are supported:
1. Create/Delete share.
2. Create/Delete snapshot.
3. Allow/Deny IP(NFS) or user(CIFS) access.
4. Get share stats.

Change-Id: Ia45e39a40bb51130216c49d08f7489bf7bbad613
Partially implements: blueprint huawei-manila-driver

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """Unit tests for the Generic driver module.""" import json import os import shutil import tempfile import time import xml.dom.minidom import mock from manila import context from manila import exception from manila.share import configuration as conf from manila.share.drivers.huawei import huawei_helper from manila.share.drivers.huawei import huawei_nas from manila import test def Fake_sleep(time): pass def data_session(url): if url == "/xx/sessions": data = """{"error":{"code":0}, "data":{"username":"admin", "iBaseToken":"2001031430", "deviceid":"210235G7J20000000000"}}""" if url == "sessions": data = '{"error":{"code":0},"data":{"ID":11}}' return data def find_data_storagepool(url, method): if url == "storagepool": data = """{"error":{"code":0}, "data":[{"USERFREECAPACITY":"985661440", "ID":"0", "NAME":"OpenStack_Pool", "USERTOTALCAPACITY":"985661440" }]}""" return data class FakeHuaweiNasDriver(huawei_nas.HuaweiNasDriver): """Fake Huawei Storage, Rewrite some methods of HuaweiISCSIDriver.""" def __init__(self, db, *args, **kwargs): huawei_nas.HuaweiNasDriver.__init__(self, db, *args, **kwargs) self._db = db configuration = self.configuration self.helper = FakeHuaweiNasHelper(self._db, configuration) class FakeHuaweiNasHelper(huawei_helper.RestHelper): def __init__(self, db, *args, **kwargs): huawei_helper.RestHelper.__init__(self, db, *args, **kwargs) self.test_normal = True self.deviceid = None self.delete_flag = False self.allow_falg = False self.deny_falg = False self.create_snapflag = False self.setupserver_flag = False def _change_file_mode(self, filepath): pass def call(self, url=False, data=None, method=None): url = url.replace('http://100.115.10.69:8082/deviceManager/rest', '') url = url.replace('/210235G7J20000000000/', '') data = None if self.test_normal: if url == "/xx/sessions" or url == "sessions": data = data_session(url) if url == "filesystem": data = """{"error":{"code":0},"data":{ "ID":"4"}}""" if url == "NFSHARE" or url == "CIFSHARE": data = """{"error":{"code":0},"data":{ "ID":"10"}}""" if url == "NFSHARE?range=[0-100]": data = """{"error":{"code":0}, "data":[{"ID":"1", "FSID":"4", "NAME":"test", "SHAREPATH":"/share_fake_uuid/"}]}""" if url == "CIFSHARE?range=[0-100]": data = """{"error":{"code":0}, "data":[{"ID":"2", "FSID":"4", "NAME":"test", "SHAREPATH":"/share_fake_uuid/"}]}""" if url == "NFSHARE/1" or url == "filesystem/4"\ or url == "CIFSHARE/2": data = """{"error":{"code":0}}""" self.delete_flag = True if url == "FSSNAPSHOT": data = """{"error":{"code":0},"data":{ "ID":"3"}}""" self.create_snapflag = True if url == "FSSNAPSHOT/3" or url == "filesystem/4": data = """{"error":{"code":0}}""" self.delete_flag = True if url == "NFS_SHARE_AUTH_CLIENT"\ or url == "CIFS_SHARE_AUTH_CLIENT": data = """{"error":{"code":0}}""" self.allow_falg = True if url == "storagepool": data = find_data_storagepool(url, method) if url == "FSSNAPSHOT?TYPE=48&PARENTID=4"\ "&&sortby=TIMESTAMP,d&range=[0-2000]": data = """{"error":{"code":0}, "data":[{"ID":"3", "NAME":"share_snapshot_fake_snapshot_uuid"}]}""" self.delete_flag = True if url == "NFS_SHARE_AUTH_CLIENT?"\ "filter=PARENTID::1&range=[0-100]": data = """{"error":{"code":0}, "data":[{"ID":"5", "NAME":"100.112.0.1"}]}""" if url == "CIFS_SHARE_AUTH_CLIENT?"\ "filter=PARENTID::2&range=[0-100]": data = """{"error":{"code":0}, "data":[{"ID":"6", "NAME":"user_name"}]}""" if url == "NFS_SHARE_AUTH_CLIENT/5"\ or url == "CIFS_SHARE_AUTH_CLIENT/6": data = """{"error":{"code":0}}""" self.deny_falg = True if url == "NFSHARE/count" or url == "CIFSHARE/count": data = """{"error":{"code":0},"data":{ "COUNT":"1"}}""" if url == "NFS_SHARE_AUTH_CLIENT/count?filter=PARENTID::1"\ or url == "CIFS_SHARE_AUTH_CLIENT/count?filter="\ "PARENTID::2": data = """{"error":{"code":0},"data":{ "COUNT":"1"}}""" if url == "CIFSSERVICE": data = """{"error":{"code":0},"data":{ "RUNNINGSTATUS":"2"}}""" if url == "NFSSERVICE": data = """{"error":{"code":0}, "data":{"RUNNINGSTATUS":"2", "SUPPORTV3":"true", "SUPPORTV4":"true"}}""" self.setupserver_flag = True if url == "FILESYSTEM?range=[0-8191]": data = """{"error":{"code":0}, "data":[{"ID":"4", "NAME":"share_fake_uuid"}]}""" else: data = '{"error":{"code":31755596}}' res_json = json.loads(data) return res_json class HuaweiShareDriverTestCase(test.TestCase): """Tests GenericShareDriver.""" def setUp(self): super(HuaweiShareDriverTestCase, self).setUp() self._context = context.get_admin_context() self._db = mock.Mock() self.tmp_dir = tempfile.mkdtemp() self.fake_conf_file = self.tmp_dir + '/manila_huawei_conf.xml' self.addCleanup(shutil.rmtree, self.tmp_dir) self.create_fake_conf_file() self.addCleanup(os.remove, self.fake_conf_file) self.configuration = mock.Mock(spec=conf.Configuration) self.configuration.manila_huawei_conf_file = self.fake_conf_file self.stubs.Set(time, 'sleep', Fake_sleep) driver = FakeHuaweiNasDriver(self._db, configuration=self.configuration) self.driver = driver self.driver.helper.test_normal = True self.share_nfs = {'id': 'fake_uuid', 'project_id': 'fake_tenant_id', 'display_name': 'fake', 'name': 'share_fake_uuid', 'size': 1, 'share_proto': 'NFS', 'share_network_id': 'fake_net_id', 'share_server_id': 'fake-share-srv-id', } self.share_cifs = {'id': 'fake_uuid', 'project_id': 'fake_tenant_id', 'display_name': 'fake', 'name': 'share_fake_uuid', 'size': 1, 'share_proto': 'CIFS', 'share_network_id': 'fake_net_id', 'share_server_id': 'fake-share-srv-id', } self.nfs_snapshot = {'id': 'fake_snapshot_uuid', 'share_name': 'share_fake_uuid', 'share_id': 'fake_uuid', 'display_name': 'snapshot', 'name': 'fake_snapshot_name', 'share_size': 1, 'size': 1, 'share_proto': 'NFS', } self.cifs_snapshot = {'id': 'fake_snapshot_uuid', 'share_name': 'share_fake_uuid', 'share_id': 'fake_uuid', 'display_name': 'snapshot', 'name': 'fake_snapshot_name', 'share_size': 1, 'size': 1, 'share_proto': 'CIFS', } self.security_service = {'id': 'fake_id', 'domain': 'FAKE', 'server': 'fake_server', 'user': 'fake_user', 'password': 'fake_password'} self.access_ip = {'access_type': 'ip', 'access_to': '100.112.0.1'} self.access_user = {'access_type': 'user', 'access_to': 'user_name'} self.share_server = None self.helper = mock.Mock() self.driver._helpers = {'FAKE': self.helper} self.driver._licenses = ['fake'] self.network_info = { 'server_id': 'fake_server_id', 'cidr': '10.0.0.0/24', 'security_services': ['fake_ldap', 'fake_kerberos', 'fake_ad', ], 'segmentation_id': '1000', 'network_allocations': [ {'id': 'fake_na_id_1', 'ip_address': 'fake_ip_1', }, {'id': 'fake_na_id_2', 'ip_address': 'fake_ip_2', }, ], } def test_login_success(self): deviceid = self.driver.helper.login() self.assertEqual(deviceid, "210235G7J20000000000") def test_create_share_nfs_success(self): self.driver.helper.login() location = self.driver.create_share(self._context, self.share_nfs, self.share_server) self.assertEqual(location, "100.115.10.68:/share_fake_uuid/") def test_create_share_cifs_success(self): self.driver.helper.login() location = self.driver.create_share(self._context, self.share_cifs, self.share_server) self.assertEqual(location, "100.115.10.68:/share_fake_uuid/") def test_login_fail(self): self.driver.helper.test_normal = False self.assertRaises(exception.ManilaException, self.driver.helper.login) def test_create_share_nfs_fail(self): self.driver.helper.login() self.driver.helper.test_normal = False self.assertRaises(exception.ManilaException, self.driver.create_share, self._context, self.share_nfs, self.share_server) def test_create_share_cifs_fail(self): self.driver.helper.login() self.driver.helper.test_normal = False self.assertRaises(exception.ManilaException, self.driver.create_share, self._context, self.share_cifs, self.share_server) def test_delete_share_nfs_success(self): self.driver.helper.login() self.driver.helper.delete_flag = False self.driver.delete_share(self._context, self.share_nfs, self.share_server) self.assertTrue(self.driver.helper.delete_flag) def test_delete_share_cifs_success(self): self.driver.helper.login() self.driver.helper.delete_flag = False self.driver.delete_share(self._context, self.share_cifs, self.share_server) self.assertTrue(self.driver.helper.delete_flag) def test_get_share_stats(self): self.driver.helper.login() data = self.driver.get_share_stats() self.assertEqual(data['share_backend_name'], "huawei_nas_driver") def test_allow_access_ip_success(self): self.driver.helper.login() self.allow_falg = False self.driver.allow_access(self._context, self.share_nfs, self.access_ip, self.share_server) self.assertTrue(self.driver.helper.allow_falg) def test_allow_access_user_success(self): self.driver.helper.login() self.allow_falg = False self.driver.allow_access(self._context, self.share_cifs, self.access_user, self.share_server) self.assertTrue(self.driver.helper.allow_falg) def test_allow_access_ip_fail(self): self.driver.helper.login() self.driver.helper.test_normal = False self.assertRaises(exception.ManilaException, self.driver.allow_access, self._context, self.share_nfs, self.access_ip, self.share_server) def test_allow_access_user_fail(self): self.driver.helper.login() self.driver.helper.test_normal = False self.assertRaises(exception.ManilaException, self.driver.allow_access, self._context, self.share_cifs, self.access_user, self.share_server) def test_deny_access_ip_success(self): self.driver.helper.login() self.deny_falg = False self.driver.deny_access(self._context, self.share_nfs, self.access_ip, self.share_server) self.assertTrue(self.driver.helper.deny_falg) def test_deny_access_user_success(self): self.driver.helper.login() self.deny_falg = False self.driver.deny_access(self._context, self.share_cifs, self.access_user, self.share_server) self.assertTrue(self.driver.helper.deny_falg) def test_deny_access_ip_fail(self): self.driver.helper.login() self.driver.helper.test_normal = False self.assertRaises(exception.ManilaException, self.driver.deny_access, self._context, self.share_nfs, self.access_ip, self.share_server) def test_deny_access_user_fail(self): self.driver.helper.login() self.driver.helper.test_normal = False self.assertRaises(exception.ManilaException, self.driver.deny_access, self._context, self.share_cifs, self.access_user, self.share_server) def test_create_nfs_snapshot_success(self): self.driver.helper.login() self.driver.helper.create_snapflag = False self.driver.create_snapshot(self._context, self.nfs_snapshot, self.share_server) self.assertTrue(self.driver.helper.create_snapflag) def test_create_cifs_snapshot_success(self): self.driver.helper.login() self.driver.helper.create_snapflag = False self.driver.create_snapshot(self._context, self.cifs_snapshot, self.share_server) self.assertTrue(self.driver.helper.create_snapflag) def test_delete_nfs_snapshot_success(self): self.driver.helper.login() self.driver.helper.delete_flag = False self.driver.delete_snapshot(self._context, self.nfs_snapshot, self.share_server) self.assertTrue(self.driver.helper.delete_flag) def test_delete_cifs_snapshot_success(self): self.driver.helper.login() self.driver.helper.delete_flag = False self.driver.delete_snapshot(self._context, self.cifs_snapshot, self.share_server) self.assertTrue(self.driver.helper.delete_flag) def test_setup_server_success(self): self.driver.helper.login() self.driver.helper.setupserver_flag = False self.driver.setup_server(self.network_info, None) self.assertTrue(self.driver.helper.setupserver_flag) def test_create_nfs_snapshot_fail(self): self.driver.helper.login() self.driver.helper.test_normal = False self.assertRaises(exception.ManilaException, self.driver.create_snapshot, self._context, self.nfs_snapshot, self.share_server) def test_create_cifs_snapshot_fail(self): self.driver.helper.login() self.driver.helper.test_normal = False self.assertRaises(exception.ManilaException, self.driver.create_snapshot, self._context, self.cifs_snapshot, self.share_server) def test_delete_nfs_snapshot_fail(self): self.driver.helper.login() self.driver.helper.test_normal = False self.assertRaises(exception.ManilaException, self.driver.delete_snapshot, self._context, self.nfs_snapshot, self.share_server) def test_delete_cifs_snapshot_fail(self): self.driver.helper.login() self.driver.helper.test_normal = False self.assertRaises(exception.ManilaException, self.driver.delete_snapshot, self._context, self.cifs_snapshot, self.share_server) def test_setup_server_fail(self): self.driver.helper.login() self.driver.helper.test_normal = False self.assertRaises(exception.ManilaException, self.driver.setup_server, self.network_info, None) def create_fake_conf_file(self): doc = xml.dom.minidom.Document() config = doc.createElement('config') doc.appendChild(config) storage = doc.createElement('Storage') config.appendChild(storage) controllerip0 = doc.createElement('ControllerIP0') controllerip0_text = doc.createTextNode('10.10.10.1') commit_message:
Make Tempest tests use networks only from same project

We have admin and common user test suites. Both are able to get networks for
its tests from any project by its names.

Make Tempest distinguish networks by projects to avoid issues related to
activities in other projects.

Change-Id: Ibd1a9d8a547639795651aa5fa16b6eb9d03e022f

commit_message:
libvirt: Handle empty context on _hard_reboot

When _hard_reboot runs for resume_guest_state_on_host_boot, we don't
have a valid context. This checks if the context is valid before
attempting to repopulate base images.

This is a bit of a hack, as it assumes that the base images already
exist on the system, and will fail if they don't. However, it reduces
the number of failures (without this, every downed guest is guaranteed
to error when coming back up for resume_guest_state_on_host_boot).

Closes-Bug: 1195884
Change-Id: Ibac52f5d1b4e5ab2adb0a561659e6df8c7c1f40f

subject: Ensure that lun_id is an int for NetApp Drivers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-22 21:00:25.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/volume/drivers/netapp/fakes.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/utils.py', 'cinder/tests/volume/drivers/netapp/test_utils.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/iscsi.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/eseries/iscsi.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/8397cf69d3b74333d5162d8d04e1688848dee47a', 'message': 'Ensure that lun_id is an int for NetApp Drivers

Various NetApp drivers were treating the lun_id as a string
rather than an int.  This was causing attempts to mount NetApp
volumes to Hyper-V nodes to fail as they were checking an integer
type against a unicode type which would fail.
This change casts result_lun to an integer after the value has
gone through the ssh injection attack check.  This way Hyper-V
is able to verify if the found LUN is the target LUN, enabling
mounting of NetApp volumes to Hyper-V.
This change also refactors initialize_connection into some helper
methods so as to enable simpler unit testing of the patchset.

Closes-bug: 1372808
Change-Id: I308b3b2dff315ec33451fb45a30ecd53d5d4c353
(cherry picked from commit:2d0204ff3ca3a7d42fac5722d577e18edd34ea83)

commit_message:
Ensure that lun_id is an int for NetApp Drivers

Various NetApp drivers were treating the lun_id as a string
rather than an int.  This was causing attempts to mount NetApp
volumes to Hyper-V nodes to fail as they were checking an integer
type against a unicode type which would fail.
This change casts result_lun to an integer after the value has
gone through the ssh injection attack check.  This way Hyper-V
is able to verify if the found LUN is the target LUN, enabling
mounting of NetApp volumes to Hyper-V.
This change also refactors initialize_connection into some helper
methods so as to enable simpler unit testing of the patchset.

Closes-bug: 1372808
Change-Id: I308b3b2dff315ec33451fb45a30ecd53d5d4c353
(cherry picked from commit:2d0204ff3ca3a7d42fac5722d577e18edd34ea83)

commit_message:
Fix foreign key constraint error on ml2_dvr_port_bindings

Get the port before creating the DVR binding. This should guarantee that, if
the port is found, no foreign key violation is triggered.

Closes-bug: #1371696

Change-Id: I90c3d6460c14ef27823be95bc26aae38eba4879a

commit_message:
Join instances column before expecting it to exist

test_create_instance_associates_security_groups was fetching a
security group without joining instances, then testing its instances
association. This causes the instances to be fetched after the db api
call has completed, and does not work when explicitly scoping a db
transaction to a db api call.

This change updates the test to explicitly fetch instances. We also
cleanup the test slightly, and add an additional assertion that the
retrieved group is the one we expected.

Change-Id: I11025d9ad13678760eae584951db22090a513645

commit_message:
Add 2014.2-6.1 release tags to versioned tests

Some of the tests should be available only after 2014.2-6.0,
right now there is no proper mechanism for ostf versioning,
but we need to bump version in openstack.yaml

related to blueprint ostf-tests-versioning

Change-Id: I16fc9f2c75d6326ba0323bb2d346feaa5597661b

commit_message:
Changes utils.get_keystone(token) to utils.check_is_admin(token)

We never use the client that get_keystone returns. We are actually
interested in whether the provided token belongs to an admin user.
This patch changes the function name to reflect this fact. It also
adds a check to make sure the token is from a user with the admin
role on the tenant provided in the admin_tenant_name configuration
option.

Change-Id: I657d14921e9a3db7fea4499144a77659bb3f390d
Closes-Bug: 1391866
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-inspector refs/changes/57/145657/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_keystone(token, tenant="admin"): # pragma: no cover return keystone.Client(token=token, auth_url=conf.get('discoverd', 'os_auth_url'), tenant=tenant)
deleted_lines: def get_keystone(token): # pragma: no cover return keystone.Client(token=token, auth_url=conf.get('discoverd', 'os_auth_url'))

commit_message:
SQL scripts should not manage transactions

Glance SQL scripts assume too much about the environment and the way in
which they are executed by sqlalchemy-migrate. Particularly, they manage
transactions on their own even though sqlalchemy-migrate do it itself,
plus it assumes that scripts are executed in one go (even though
standard Python DB-API 2.0 does not mention multi-statement SQL commands
to be executed on DB cursors.

Also fix comments to be actual SQL comments and not C comments

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo.db/+spec/enable-mysql-connector

Change-Id: I10c58b3af75d3ab9153a8bbd2a539bf1577de328
Closes-Bug: 1368391
Closes-Bug: 1410494

commit_message:
Remove match-by argument for alarm-definition-patch

The user is not allowed to change the value of match-by for an
existing alarm definition so don't allow it as an option

Change-Id: Iaa4dc0b9f37018d7511949eb697e4ddd45b4b7d5

commit_message:
Provided backward compat for enforcing admin policy

The ContextHook API hook was changed in a way that it cannot
construct an admin-enabled context with the default juno
policy.json, preventing admin users from using the API.  This
updates it to enforce the previous 'admin' rule in addtion
to the new 'admin_api' rule.

Change-Id: I47985e8989837ce8a9e44bbf5a068ddfcab179f6
Closes-bug: #1408808
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/84/145984/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def __init__(self, compat=None): self.compat = compat def setUp(self, compat=None): policy_file.write(fake_policy.get_policy_data(self.compat))

commit_message:
make transformers optional in pipeline

in the code we note that transformers do not need to be specified
but for some reason we have tests to ensure PipelineManager fails
if transformer is not specified. this patch adjust tests to make
sure PipelineManager does not fail if transformer is not specified.

Change-Id: I00c0e94da19d54c754bcf564d99eb439d2a820a1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/45/145345/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pipeline.PipelineManager(self.pipeline_cfg, self.transformer_manager)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-02 09:54:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-main/commit/a8045972dcdd9b0794a3b785de21e77830e6e22e', 'message': "Use aptly instead of custom scripts for building repos

Currently, we are building ubuntu mirror by 'multistrap', then
mkrepo.sh which copying .deb from /var/cache/, downloading
other .deb and .udeb and creating local mirror.

First point is multistrap is not available on RHEL, SUSE, etc.
Second point is building chroot, configuring pkgs, directly
downloading packages is slow and we can't maintenance this easy.

Now we will use one docker container, run 'aptly' inside, do mirror all
.udeb and .deb from requirements-deb.txt and pushing it to local_mirror/

commit_message:
Use aptly instead of custom scripts for building repos

Currently, we are building ubuntu mirror by 'multistrap', then
mkrepo.sh which copying .deb from /var/cache/, downloading
other .deb and .udeb and creating local mirror.

First point is multistrap is not available on RHEL, SUSE, etc.
Second point is building chroot, configuring pkgs, directly
downloading packages is slow and we can't maintenance this easy.

Now we will use one docker container, run 'aptly' inside, do mirror all
.udeb and .deb from requirements-deb.txt and pushing it to local_mirror/

blueprint build-iso-on-fedora
Signed-off-by: Igor Gnatenko <ignatenko@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: Ieb23c70f31633f651abc1f8700e039700dca669c

deleted_lines: define SANDBOX_UBUNTU_UP echo "SANDBOX_UBUNTU_UP: start" mkdir -p $(SANDBOX_UBUNTU) echo "Running debootstrap" sudo debootstrap --no-check-gpg --arch=$(UBUNTU_ARCH) $(UBUNTU_RELEASE) $(SANDBOX_UBUNTU) file://$(LOCAL_MIRROR)/ubuntu sudo cp /etc/resolv.conf $(SANDBOX_UBUNTU)/etc/resolv.conf echo "Generating utf8 locale" sudo chroot $(SANDBOX_UBUNTU) /bin/sh -c 'locale-gen en_US.UTF-8; dpkg-reconfigure locales' echo "Preparing directory for chroot local mirror" test -e $(SANDBOX_UBUNTU)/tmp/apt && sudo rm -rf $(SANDBOX_UBUNTU)/tmp/apt sudo mkdir -p $(SANDBOX_UBUNTU)/tmp/apt echo "Copying local ubuntu mirror into $(SANDBOX_UBUNTU)/tmp/apt" sudo cp -al $(LOCAL_MIRROR)/ubuntu/dists $(LOCAL_MIRROR)/ubuntu/pool $(SANDBOX_UBUNTU)/tmp/apt echo "Configuring apt sources.list: deb file:///tmp/apt $(UBUNTU_RELEASE) main" echo "deb file:///tmp/apt $(UBUNTU_RELEASE) main" | sudo tee $(SANDBOX_UBUNTU)/etc/apt/sources.list echo "Allowing using unsigned repos" echo "APT::Get::AllowUnauthenticated 1;" | sudo tee $(SANDBOX_UBUNTU)/etc/apt/apt.conf.d/02mirantis-unauthenticated echo "Updating apt package database" sudo chroot $(SANDBOX_UBUNTU) apt-get update echo "Installing additional packages: $(SANDBOX_DEB_PKGS)" test -n "$(SANDBOX_DEB_PKGS)" && sudo chroot $(SANDBOX_UBUNTU) apt-get install --yes $(SANDBOX_DEB_PKGS) echo "SANDBOX_UBUNTU_UP: done" endef define SANDBOX_UBUNTU_DOWN sync sudo umount $(SANDBOX_UBUNTU)/proc endef

commit_message:
untie pipeline manager from samples

currently the pipeline manager is directly tied to sample. the
pipeline can be made agnostic to samples so that we can reuse
portions of existing pipeline for event pipeline.

Change-Id: Ibc4790a169d3533df464cad048866bd0b57c4dc8
Implements: blueprint notification-pipelines

commit_message:
Add read-only functional tests

Add more read-only functional tests. It allows us to use only
manilaclient's own functional tests and CLI tests from Manila Tempest plugin
are not required anymore.

Partially implements bp functional-tests

Change-Id: I6ff3fb79740b958581c2536bac353935d53c9bae

share from snapshot # 2) add parsing of output values to verify that there is no values # other than in filter. # 3) add support of test flags for users # 4) add tests for 'create', 'get', 'delete'... def test_manila_list_by_admin(self): self.clients['admin'].manila('list') def test_manila_list_by_user(self): tt = self.clients['user'].manila('list') def test_manila_list_with_retries(self): for user in self.users: self.clients[user].manila('list', flags='--retries 3') def test_manila_list_with_debug(self): for user in self.users: self.clients[user].manila('list', flags='--debug') def test_manila_list_with_all_tenants(self): self.clients['admin'].manila('list', params='--all-tenants') def test_manila_list_with_name_filter(self): self.clients['admin'].manila('list', params='--name fake_name') def test_manila_list_with_status_filter(self): self.clients['admin'].manila('list', params='--status fake_status') def test_manila_list_with_share_server_id_filter_by_admin(self): aliases = [ '--share-server-id', '--share-server_id', '--share_server-id', '--share_server_id', ] for alias in aliases: self.clients['admin'].manila( 'list', params=alias + ' fake_share_server_id') def test_manila_list_with_metadata_filter(self): for user in self.users: self.clients[user].manila('list', params='--metadata foo=bar') def test_manila_list_with_extra_specs_filter_by_admin(self): aliases = ['--extra-specs', '--extra_specs'] for alias in aliases: self.clients['admin'].manila('list', params=alias + ' foo=bar') @testtools.testcase.attr('negative') def test_manila_list_with_extra_specs_filter_by_user(self): aliases = ['--extra-specs', '--extra_specs'] for alias in aliases: self.assertRaises( exceptions.CommandFailed, self.clients['user'].manila, 'list', params=alias + ' foo=bar', ) def test_manila_list_with_host_filter(self): for user in self.users: self.clients[user].manila('list', params='--host fake_host') @testtools.skip('Should run with existing snapshot') def test_manila_list_with_snapshot_filter(self): for user in self.users: self.clients[user].manila('list', params='--snapshot fake_snapshot') def test_manila_list_with_project_id_filter(self): aliases = ['--project-id', '--project_id'] for user in self.users: for alias in aliases: self.clients[user].manila( 'list', params=alias + ' fake_project_id') @testtools.skip('Should run with existing volume type') def test_manila_list_with_volume_type_filter(self): aliases = [ '--volume-type', '--volume_type', '--volume-type-id', '--volume-type_id', '--volume_type-id', '--volume_type_id', ] for user in self.users: for alias in aliases: self.clients[user].manila('list', params=alias + ' fake_vt') def test_manila_list_with_limited_by_zero(self): for user in self.users: self.clients[user].manila('list', params='--limit 0') def test_manila_list_with_limited_by_one(self): for user in self.users: self.clients[user].manila('list', params='--limit 1') def test_manila_list_with_offset(self): for user in self.users: self.clients[user].manila('list', params='--offset 1') def test_manila_list_with_sort_key(self): aliases = ['--sort-key', '--sort_key'] for user in self.users: for alias in aliases: # TODO(vponomaryov): add all possible keys self.clients[user].manila('list', params=alias + ' status') def test_manila_list_with_sort_dir(self): aliases = ['--sort-dir', '--sort_dir'] for user in self.users: for alias in aliases: for sdir in ['asc', 'desc']: self.clients[user].manila('list', params=alias + ' ' + sdir) @testtools.skip('Should run with existing share-network') def test_manila_list_with_share_network_filter(self): aliases = ['--share-network', '--share_network'] for user in self.users: for alias in aliases: self.clients[user].manila('list', params=alias + ' fake_sn')
